abstract: This chapter examines two quite different constructivist theories of learning--Piagetian, and Situated Social Learning--in relation to how they are used in considerations of teaching and teacher education. It also discusses the various dilemmas that teachers and teacher educators face as they attempt to bring constructivist theories in the classroom.
